page.title: 03RIDING AT WAPLEY STABLES
page.content: { Wapley Stables}is home for 16 horses and ponies aged between 3 and 14 years. 18 acres of grazing land belongs to the stables and a further 12 acres are rented. During weekdays lessons are given to{handicapped people and a few house-wives. The busiest day is Saturday when{lessons or{rides}are given to about 30 people who mostly come from{Yate}as well as some from Filton. The rides go along the{bridle paths}towards the M4 motorway. Eachday the owner and helpers have to {groom}the horses,water them,feed them and muck out the stables. Horses and ponies are exercised everyday. Most of the horses are bought privately but three are kept and looked after for other owners. The people who work at the stables enjoy their work very much.
